docTitle.name: shortTitle
docTitle.content: Securities and Futures (OTC Derivative Products) Notice

def.name: UnderlyingSubjectMatter
def.leadIn: underlying subject matter (標的項目)—(a)in relation to a transaction in a structured product that falls within subsection (1)(a)(i) of section 1A of Part 1 of Schedule 1 of the Ordinance, means any type or combination of types of securities, commodity, index, property, interest rate, currency exchange rate or futures contract;(b)in relation to a transaction in a structured product that falls within subsection (1)(a)(ii) of section 1A of Part 1 of Schedule 1 of the Ordinance, means any basket of more than one type, or any combination of types, of securities, commodity, index, property, interest rate, currency exchange rate or futures contract; and(c)in relation to a transaction in a structured product that falls within subsection (1)(a)(iii) of section 1A of Part 1 of Schedule 1 of the Ordinance, means any specified event or events (excluding an event or events relating only to the issuer or guarantor of the instrument or to both the issuer and the guarantor).

section.name: s3
section.heading: Structured product that is not regarded as OTC derivative product
section.content: The structured product set out in the Schedule is not to be regarded as an OTC derivative product for the purposes of the Ordinance.

schedule.name: sch0
schedule.heading: Structured Product Not to be Regarded as OTC Derivative Product

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: gives its holder the right to purchase its underlying subject matter;

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: is either settled in cash or physically settled;

subsection.name: c
d
subsection.content: has its strike price specified as, or in effect set at, zero or an amount close to zero;

subsection.name: e
subsection.content: is not subject to any restriction on its transfer (other than a restriction imposed solely for the purpose of complying with applicable legal or regulatory requirements); and

subsection.name: f
subsection.content: is documented in the form of a warrant.
